A competing team can consist of 1 to 4 members.
The competition will have 2 rounds where teams compete within a given set of task-based challenges in a timed setting.
The first round will be held online and the second round will be held at the SLIIT Malabe campus.
Each team must register through the competition platform by entering team details and necessary information about its members.
The challenges will be available on the competition platform once the competition begins.
All team members must login with the same credentials provided during team registration.
Points will be assigned according to challenges and sub-tasks of each challenge.
The highest and the fastest scoring team will be considered the winner and a leaderboard of this will be updated in real time.
A team can submit multiple submissions to a single challenge, but only the submission with the highest mark will be considered.

When the competition ends, we will publish a public repository under the SLIIT FOSS Community GitHub profile. We will include the solutions of each team, hoping that this will help share knowledge and show our transparency.
The rankings in the leaderboard will be final.*
